rquery
  • Reference

Make a natural_join node.

Natural join is a join by identity on all common columns.

natural_join(a, b, jointype = "INNER")

Arguments

a

source to select from.
b

source to select from.
jointype

type of join ('INNER', 'LEFT', 'RIGHT', 'FULL').

Value

natural_join node.

Examples


my_db <- DBI::dbConnect(RSQLite::SQLite(), ":memory:")
d1 <- dbi_copy_to(my_db, 'd1',
                 data.frame(AUC = 0.6, R2 = 0.2))
d2 <- dbi_copy_to(my_db, 'd2',
                 data.frame(AUC = 0.6, D = 0.3))
eqn <- natural_join(d1, d2)
cat(format(eqn))
#> dbi_table('d1') %.>%
#>  natural_join(.,
#>   dbi_table('d2'),
#>   j= INNER, by= AUC)
sql <- to_sql(eqn)
cat(sql)
#> SELECT tsql_0000.*, `D` FROM (
#>  SELECT
#>   `d1`.`AUC`,
#>   `d1`.`R2`
#>  FROM
#>   `d1`
#> ) tsql_0000
#> INNER JOIN (
#>  SELECT
#>   `d2`.`AUC`,
#>   `d2`.`D`
#>  FROM
#>   `d2`
#> ) tsql_0001
#> ON
#>  tsql_0000.`AUC` = tsql_0001.`AUC`
DBI::dbGetQuery(my_db, sql)
#>   AUC  R2   D
#> 1 0.6 0.2 0.3
DBI::dbDisconnect(my_db)
